title: How a ban on single-use plastics creates new opportunities for the paper industry - The Times of India
summary: The article discusses the impact of India's ban on single-use plastics, leading to increased opportunities for the paper industry through the demand for environmentally friendly paper products, investment in R&D, and the creation of job opportunities.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 322121 - Paper (except Newsprint) Mills, 322130 - Paperboard Mills, 322299 - All Other Converted Paper Product Manufacturing, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services

title: BRIEF23 | Anil Chowta, Ecosac: A limitation is in one's mind- what you believe, you will achieve - Mediabrief
summary: Anil Chowta, the Founder of Ecosac, launched eco-friendly products like reusable bags and compostable garbage bags in response to the growing demand for sustainable solutions in 2022. The company experienced growth in online quick-service business, highlighted global acceptance towards sustainability, and an increase in travel influenced sales and expansion. Looking ahead, Ecosac plans to capitalize on the opportunities presented by CoP 27 for sustainable growth and aims to launch new product ranges while focusing on D2C branding.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 424330 - Women's, Children's, and Infants' Clothing and Accessories Merchant Wholesalers, 424340 - Footwear Merchant Wholesalers, 424990 - Other Miscellaneous Nondurable Goods Merchant Wholesalers, 453998 - All Other Miscellaneous Store Retailers (except Tobacco Stores)

title: Tech-driven Supply Chain and Trend Analyses Make Arrow India Omni-enabled - Indian Retailer
summary: The article discusses how various beauty and personal care brands in India have made strides in their growth, expansion plans, and sustainability efforts for the coming year.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article primarily focuses on the growth and strategies of beauty and personal care brands and does not emphasize innovations targeting environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article showcases how beauty and personal care brands have introduced new strategies in their marketing, retail expansions, and product offerings, demonstrating business innovations.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions several beauty brands focusing on vegan, recyclable, and environmentally friendly products in their portfolios, qualifying them as green products.
green_process: FALSE. Although the article talks about brand expansions, retail strategies, and revenue growth, it does not specifically highlight any new environmentally friendly processes within the operations of these beauty brands.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 446120 - Cosmetics, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores, 325620 - Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 446190 - Other Personal Care Services, 812112 - Beauty Salons
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not demonstrate characteristics of greenwashing as it mainly focuses on the growth, expansion plans, and sustainability efforts of beauty and personal care brands.
